column4: can someone tell me why i cannot play mp3 files in rhythymbox?
visit the wiki page ubotu just said
in a terminal do 'sudo aptitude install gstreamer0.8-mad' and paste the command and output on http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/ and give us a link
are you using dapper or breezy?
i am using dapper dan i believe
put your /etc/apt/sources.list on pastebin
interesting, try 'sudo apt-get update' and then installing again.  If it still doesn't work, you'll have to visit #ubuntu+1 as that is the dapper channel anyway and they will know more
wait, I see a problem in your /etc/apt/sources.list.  Does your line 30 really contain '$' like that?
no, it does not.
k, try #ubuntu+1 then
#ubuntu+1 for dapper
heh did you get that mp3 thing sorted, I just looked at your /etc/apt/sources.list as I was closing it and realized you are using breezy, not ``dapper dan'' :)
see what ubotu said above about icons ^
did you install gstreamer0.8-mad?
close rhythmbox, run gst-register-0.8, and try rhythmbox again
k, i got it to work
great
it means you don't have permission
first, you make sure that you know what you are doing so you don't break anything, then you can use 'sudo'
actually i am installing a program, a dynamic ip update client, and when i used the make install command as instructed in the readme i got that error
use checkinstall instead, install checkinstall with apt, and then you use 'sudo checkinstall' instead of make install
